001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007/**
008 * Represents the demographic information of a {@link Person} in the simulation.
009 * This immutable value object holds static attributes such as age and spatial
010 * location, and provides methods to access these properties. It is designed to
011 * be {@link Serializable}.
012 */
013@Value.Immutable
014public interface PersonDemographic extends Serializable {
015
016        /**
017         * Creates a stub {@link ImmutablePersonDemographic} instance associated with
018         * a given {@link Person}. This factory method is useful for initializing
019         * demographic data for a new person with default values.
020         *
021         * @param person The {@link Person} entity for which to create the
022         *               demographic stub.
023         * @return A new {@link ImmutablePersonDemographic} instance.
024         */
025        public static ImmutablePersonDemographic stub(Person person) {
026                return ImmutablePersonDemographic.builder().setEntity(person).build();
027        }
028
029        /**
030         * Returns the age of the person. Defaults to {@code Double.NaN} if not
031         * explicitly set.
032         *
033         * @return The age of the person.
034         */
035        @Value.Default
036        default double getAge() { return Double.NaN; }
037
038        /**
039         * Returns the {@link Person} entity to which these demographic details
040         * belong.
041         *
042         * @return The associated {@link Person} entity.
043         */
044        Person getEntity();
045
046        /**
047         * Retrieves the Hilbert curve coordinates for the associated person. These
048         * coordinates are used to determine the spatial location (X, Y) of the
049         * person.
050         *
051         * @return An array of two doubles representing the Hilbert X and Y
052         *         coordinates.
053         */
054        private double[] getHilbertCoordinates() {
055                return this.getEntity().getOutbreak().getSetupConfiguration()
056                                .getHilbertCoords(this.getEntity().getId());
057        }
058
059        /**
060         * Returns the X-coordinate of the person's location. This is derived from
061         * the Hilbert curve coordinates.
062         *
063         * @return The X-coordinate of the person's location.
064         */
065        @Value.Default
066        default double getLocationX() { return this.getHilbertCoordinates()[0]; }
067
068        /**
069         * Returns the Y-coordinate of the person's location. This is derived from
070         * the Hilbert curve coordinates.
071         *
072         * @return The Y-coordinate of the person's location.
073         */
074        @Value.Default
075        default double getLocationY() { return this.getHilbertCoordinates()[1]; }
076
077        // TODO: this is too slow. The calibrator has done this already for all
078        // agents and we need to reuse. see Calibration.networkDegreePerPerson()
079        // We also want to rationalise this so that the networks can be easily
080        // switched into CSR format for eigenvalue estimatation.
081
082//      @Value.Lazy default double getExpectedContactDegree() {
083//              int id = this.getEntity().getId();
084//              Outbreak outbreak = this.getEntity().getOutbreak();
085//              return outbreak.getSocialNetwork().stream()
086//                              .filter(r -> r.getPeopleIds().contains(id))
087//                              .mapToDouble(r -> {
088//                                      Person person1 = r.getSource(outbreak);
089//                                      Person person2 = r.getTarget(outbreak);
090//                                      return r.contactProbability(
091//                                                      person1.getBaseline().getMobilityBaseline(),
092//                                                      person2.getBaseline().getMobilityBaseline());
093//                              })
094//                              .sum();
095//      }
096
097}
